00011 ORSocketReader::ORSocketReader(const char* host, int port, bool writable) 
00012 {
00013   Initialize();
00014   fSocket = new TSocket(host, port);
00015   fIOwnSocket = true;
00016   if (writable) fSocketToWrite = fSocket;
00017   else fSocketToWrite = NULL;
00018   fSocketIsOK = true;
00019 }

00031 ORSocketReader::~ORSocketReader()
00032 {
00033   StopThread();
00034   if (fCircularBuffer.buffer) delete [] fCircularBuffer.buffer;
00035   pthread_attr_destroy(&fThreadAttr);
00036   pthread_rwlock_destroy(&fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00037   if (fIOwnSocket) delete fSocket; 
00038 }
00039 
00040 void ORSocketReader::Initialize()
00041 {
00042   memset(&fCircularBuffer, 0, sizeof(fCircularBuffer));
00043   fCircularBuffer.buffer = NULL;
00044   fCircularBuffer.isRunning = false;
00045   pthread_rwlock_init(&fCircularBuffer.cbMutex, NULL);
00046 
00047   SetCircularBufferLength(kDefaultBufferLength);
00048 
00049   pthread_attr_init(&fThreadAttr);
00050   pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&fThreadAttr, PTHREAD_CREATE_JOINABLE);
00051   memset(&fLocalBuffer, 0, sizeof(fLocalBuffer));
00052   fLocalBuffer.buffer = NULL;
00053   fSleepTime = 1;
00054 }
00055 
00056 bool ORSocketReader::ThreadIsStillRunning()
00057 {
00058   bool threadIsStillRunning;
00059   pthread_rwlock_rdlock(&fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00060   threadIsStillRunning = fCircularBuffer.isRunning;
00061   pthread_rwlock_unlock(&fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00062   return threadIsStillRunning;
00063 }
00064 
00065 bool ORSocketReader::StartThread()
00066 {
00067   if (ThreadIsStillRunning()) return true;
00068   if (!fSocketIsOK || TestCancel()) {
00069     return false;
00070   }
00071   if (!fSocket->IsValid()) return false;
00072 
00073   ResetCircularBuffer();
00074   fCircularBuffer.isRunning = true;
00075 
00076   Int_t retValue = pthread_create(&fThreadId, 
00077     &fThreadAttr, SocketReadoutThread, this);
00078   if (retValue == 0) {
00079     return true;
00080   }
00081 
00082   fCircularBuffer.isRunning = false;
00083   return false; 
00084 }
00085 
00086 void ORSocketReader::StopThread()
00087 {
00088   /* This function blocks until the thread stops. */
00089   if (!ThreadIsStillRunning()) return;  
00090   Int_t retValue = 0;
00091   if ((retValue = pthread_cancel(fThreadId)) != 0) {
00092     /* Some pthread implementations will return an error if the thread has already quit. */
00093   } else {
00094     // block until the thread actual stops.
00095     pthread_join(fThreadId, 0);
00096   }
00097   fCircularBuffer.isRunning = false;
00098 }
00099 
00100 void ORSocketReader::ResetCircularBuffer()
00101 {
00102   /* Not thread safe, be careful! */
00103   if (fCircularBuffer.buffer) delete [] fCircularBuffer.buffer;
00104   fCircularBuffer.buffer = new UInt_t[fBufferLength];
00105   fCircularBuffer.bufferLength = fBufferLength;
00106   fCircularBuffer.amountInBuffer = 0;
00107   fCircularBuffer.writeIndex = 0;
00108   fCircularBuffer.readIndex = 0;
00109   fCircularBuffer.lostLongCount = 0;
00110   fCircularBuffer.wrapArounds = 0;
00111   fCircularBuffer.isRunning = false;
00112   fLocalBuffer.bufferLength = fBufferLength >> 4;
00113   if (fLocalBuffer.buffer) delete [] fLocalBuffer.buffer;
00114   fLocalBuffer.buffer = new UInt_t[fLocalBuffer.bufferLength];
00115   fLocalBuffer.currentAmountOfData = 0; 
00116   fLocalBuffer.readIndex = 0;
00117 }
00118 
00119 Int_t ORSocketReader::WriteBuffer(const void* buffer, size_t nBytes)
00120 {
00121   if (!fSocketToWrite) return 0;
00122   fSocketToWrite->Select(TSocket::kWrite); 
00123   Int_t numBytes;
00124   do { 
00125     numBytes = fSocketToWrite->SendRaw(buffer, nBytes);
00126   } while (numBytes == -4);
00127   return numBytes;
00128 }
00129 
00130 size_t ORSocketReader::ReadFromCircularBuffer(UInt_t* buffer, size_t numLongWords, size_t minimumWords)
00131 {
00132   size_t firstRead = 0, secondRead = 0;
00133   size_t tempReadIndex = 0, tempNumWords = 0;
00134   pthread_rwlock_rdlock(&fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00135 
00136   if (numLongWords > fCircularBuffer.amountInBuffer) {
00137     /* Block until there's something to read. */
00138     while(1) {
00139       /* In this while loop, we sleep to wait for data available.  If any data are 
00140          available it grabs as much as it can after one sleep cycle.  If nothing
00141          is in the circular buffer, it waits. */
00142       /* unlock before we wait to not deadlock. */
00143       pthread_rwlock_unlock(&fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00144       if (fSleepTime != 0) sleep(fSleepTime);
00145       /* Relock and keep it if we break out of this loop. */
00146       pthread_rwlock_rdlock(&fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00147       /* There is a sufficient amount in the buffer, read it out. */
00148       if (numLongWords <= fCircularBuffer.amountInBuffer) break;
00149       /* If we have exceeded the number of wait cycles, just grab what we can. */
00150       if (!fCircularBuffer.isRunning || fCircularBuffer.amountInBuffer >= minimumWords) {
00151         numLongWords = fCircularBuffer.amountInBuffer; 
00152         break;
00153       }
00154       if (TestCancel()) return 0; // We've been canceled, get out
00155     }
00156   }
00157 
00158   if (numLongWords == 0) {
00159     return 0;
00160     pthread_rwlock_unlock(&fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00161   }
00162   tempNumWords = 0;
00163   tempReadIndex = fCircularBuffer.readIndex;
00164   firstRead = (fCircularBuffer.readIndex > fCircularBuffer.writeIndex) ?
00165     fCircularBuffer.bufferLength - fCircularBuffer.readIndex :
00166     fCircularBuffer.writeIndex - fCircularBuffer.readIndex;
00167 
00168   if (firstRead > numLongWords) firstRead = numLongWords;
00169   secondRead = (firstRead < numLongWords) ? numLongWords - firstRead : 0;
00170 
00171   /* Now copy out. */
00172   memcpy(buffer, fCircularBuffer.buffer + tempReadIndex, firstRead*4);
00173   tempReadIndex += firstRead;
00174   tempNumWords += firstRead;
00175 
00176   if (tempReadIndex == fCircularBuffer.bufferLength) {
00177     tempReadIndex = 0;
00178   }
00179   if (secondRead != 0) {
00180     memcpy(buffer + firstRead, 
00181       fCircularBuffer.buffer + tempReadIndex, secondRead*4);
00182     tempReadIndex += secondRead;
00183     tempNumWords += secondRead;
00184   }
00185   if (fCircularBuffer.lostLongCount != 0) {
00186     /* Give a quick notification. */
00187     ORLog(kWarning) << "Socket has thrown away " << fCircularBuffer.lostLongCount 
00188       << " long words" << std::endl;
00189   }
00190   pthread_rwlock_unlock(&fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00191 
00192   /* Now we write. */
00193   pthread_rwlock_wrlock(&fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00194   fCircularBuffer.readIndex = tempReadIndex;
00195   fCircularBuffer.amountInBuffer -= tempNumWords;
00196   fCircularBuffer.lostLongCount = 0;
00197   pthread_rwlock_unlock(&fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00198 
00199   return numLongWords;
00200 }
00201 
00202 size_t ORSocketReader::Read(char* buffer, size_t nBytes)
00203 {
00204   if(nBytes==0) return nBytes;
00205   if(nBytes % 4 != 0) {
00206     ORLog(kWarning) << "Request for bytes: " << nBytes << " not a factor of 4" 
00207       << std::endl;
00208     return 0; 
00209   }
00210   
00211   /* We read in from a linear buffer that we fill up when it empties.  */
00212   /* This is to avoid obtaining mutex locks all the time. */
00213 
00214   size_t numLongsToRead = nBytes/4;
00215   size_t numToRead = 0; 
00216   size_t bufferPosition = 0;
00217   while (numLongsToRead !=0) {
00218     numToRead = fLocalBuffer.currentAmountOfData - fLocalBuffer.readIndex;
00219     if (numToRead == 0) {
00220       fLocalBuffer.currentAmountOfData = 
00221         ReadFromCircularBuffer(fLocalBuffer.buffer, fLocalBuffer.bufferLength, numLongsToRead);
00222       fLocalBuffer.readIndex = 0;
00223       /* The following indicates the circular buffer is empty and won't fill up.*/
00224       if (fLocalBuffer.currentAmountOfData == 0) break; 
00225     }
00226     numToRead = 
00227       (numLongsToRead > fLocalBuffer.currentAmountOfData - fLocalBuffer.readIndex) ? 
00228       fLocalBuffer.currentAmountOfData - fLocalBuffer.readIndex : numLongsToRead;
00229     memcpy(buffer + bufferPosition, fLocalBuffer.buffer + fLocalBuffer.readIndex, 4*numToRead); 
00230     numLongsToRead -= numToRead;
00231     fLocalBuffer.readIndex += numToRead;
00232     bufferPosition += 4*numToRead;
00233   }
00234   return (nBytes - 4*numLongsToRead);
00235 }
00236 
00237 /* These are private functions designed to be used by SocketReadoutThread and the class */
00238 Int_t WriteToRootSocket(TSocket* sock, void* buffer, Int_t length)
00239 {
00240     Int_t socketDescriptor = sock->GetDescriptor();
00241     Int_t numBytesWritten;
00242     Int_t totalBytesWritten = 0;
00243     char* charBuffer = (char*) buffer;
00244     while (length > 0) {
00245       // This cycles around a would block status
00246       fd_set fileDescSet;
00247       struct timeval timeout;
00248       timeout.tv_sec = 1;
00249       timeout.tv_usec = 0;
00250       FD_ZERO(&fileDescSet);
00251       FD_SET(socketDescriptor, &fileDescSet);
00252 
00253       numBytesWritten = select(socketDescriptor+1, 0, &fileDescSet, 0, &timeout);
00254       if (numBytesWritten == 0) continue; // timeout
00255       if (numBytesWritten < 0) { 
00256         if (errno == EAGAIN) continue;
00257         numBytesWritten = 0;
00258         break;
00259       }
00260       /* We get here, it means data can be sent. */
00261       numBytesWritten = send(socketDescriptor, charBuffer, length, 0);
00262       if (numBytesWritten > 0) {
00263         length -= numBytesWritten;
00264         charBuffer += numBytesWritten;
00265         totalBytesWritten += numBytesWritten;
00266       } else if (numBytesWritten == 0) break;
00267       // Cycle around.  If there's another problem, it should be caught by select
00268     } 
00269     return totalBytesWritten;
00270 
00271 
00272 }
00273 Int_t ReadoutRootSocket(TSocket* sock, void* buffer, Int_t length, ESendRecvOptions opt = kDefault)
00274 {
00275     Int_t socketDescriptor = sock->GetDescriptor();
00276     Int_t numBytesRead;
00277     Int_t totalBytesRead = 0;
00278     char* charBuffer = (char*) buffer;
00279     while (length > 0) {
00280       // This cycles around a would block status
00281       fd_set fileDescSet;
00282       struct timeval timeout;
00283       timeout.tv_sec = 1;
00284       timeout.tv_usec = 0;
00285       FD_ZERO(&fileDescSet);
00286       FD_SET(socketDescriptor, &fileDescSet);
00287 
00288       numBytesRead = select(socketDescriptor+1, &fileDescSet, 0, 0, &timeout);
00289       if (numBytesRead == 0) continue; // timeout
00290       if (numBytesRead < 0) { 
00291         if (errno == EAGAIN) continue;
00292         numBytesRead = 0;
00293         break;
00294       }
00295       /* We get here, it means data is available. */
00296       if (opt == kPeek) {
00297         numBytesRead = recv(socketDescriptor, charBuffer, length, MSG_PEEK);
00298       } else {
00299         numBytesRead = recv(socketDescriptor, charBuffer, length, MSG_WAITALL);
00300       }
00301       if (numBytesRead > 0) {
00302         length -= numBytesRead;
00303         charBuffer += numBytesRead;
00304         totalBytesRead += numBytesRead;
00305       } else if (numBytesRead == 0) break;
00306       // Cycle around.  If there's another problem, it should be caught by select
00307     } 
00308     return totalBytesRead;
00309 
00310 }
00311 
00312 void* SocketReadoutThread(void* input)
00313 {
00314   /* Readout Thread which sucks info out of socket as fast as it can. */
00315   /* Currently, it throws data away that it can't process. */
00316   
00317   bool firstWordRead = false;
00318   bool mustSwap = false;
00319   Int_t numBytesRead = 0, numLongsToRead = 0, amountAbleToRead = 0, firstRead = 0,
00320     secondRead = 0;
00321   const size_t sizeOfScratchBuffer = 0xFFFF;
00322   UInt_t scratchBuffer[sizeOfScratchBuffer];
00323   ORSocketReader* socketReader = reinterpret_cast<ORSocketReader*>(input);
00324 
00325   if (socketReader == NULL) pthread_exit((void *) -1);
00326 
00327   /* Here we set up the select function.  We do not use the ROOT version because
00328      it emits Events which are not pleasant to deal with in Threads. */
00329 
00330   TSocket* sock = socketReader->fSocket;
00331   //fd_set fileDescriptors; 
00332 
00333   while (socketReader->fSocketIsOK) {
00334     /* In this thread, we readout the socket into the circular buffer. */
00335     pthread_testcancel(); // When we are here, it is safe to cancel the thread.
00336 
00337     numBytesRead = ReadoutRootSocket(sock, scratchBuffer, 
00338                                 sizeof(UInt_t), kPeek);
00339     if (numBytesRead <= 0) {
00340       // Something is wrong with the socket
00341       socketReader->fSocketIsOK = false;
00342       break;
00343     }
00344 
00345     // Only do the following once:
00346     /* Check the first word to determine if we must swap. */
00347     if (!firstWordRead) {
00348       ORHeaderDecoder headerDec;
00349       ORHeaderDecoder::EOrcaStreamVersion version = 
00350         headerDec.GetStreamVersion(scratchBuffer[0]);
00351       if (version == ORHeaderDecoder::kOld) {
00352         mustSwap = ORUtils::SysIsLittleEndian();
00353       }
00354       else if (version == ORHeaderDecoder::kNewUnswapped) {
00355         mustSwap = false; 
00356       }
00357       else if (version == ORHeaderDecoder::kNewSwapped) {
00358         mustSwap = true;
00359       }
00360       else if (version == ORHeaderDecoder::kUnknownVersion) {
00361         /* Get out, something is wrong. */
00362         socketReader->fSocketIsOK = false;
00363         break;
00364       }
00365       firstWordRead = true;
00366     }
00367 
00368     // Check to see the number of words to read out for this record
00369     if (mustSwap) ORUtils::Swap(scratchBuffer[0]);
00370     numLongsToRead = socketReader->fBasicDecoder.LengthOf(scratchBuffer);
00371     
00372     /* We're beginning to work on the circular buffer. */
00373     pthread_rwlock_rdlock(&socketReader->fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00374 
00375     amountAbleToRead = socketReader->fCircularBuffer.bufferLength 
00376       - socketReader->fCircularBuffer.amountInBuffer; 
00377 
00378     /*************************************************************/
00379     /* Dealing with a record if we don't have room for it. */
00380     /*************************************************************/
00381     if (amountAbleToRead < numLongsToRead) {
00382       /* Do we wait, or throw away data? */
00383       /* Throw away data now. */
00384       // fixME, this needs to be set in an option
00385       pthread_rwlock_unlock(&socketReader->fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00386       pthread_rwlock_wrlock(&socketReader->fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00387       socketReader->fCircularBuffer.lostLongCount += numLongsToRead;
00388       pthread_rwlock_unlock(&socketReader->fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00389 
00390       while (numLongsToRead > 0) {
00391         numBytesRead = ReadoutRootSocket(sock, scratchBuffer, 
00392           (((size_t)numLongsToRead > sizeOfScratchBuffer) ? 
00393             sizeOfScratchBuffer : numLongsToRead)*sizeof(UInt_t));
00394         if (numBytesRead <=0 || numBytesRead % sizeof(UInt_t) != 0) break;
00395         numLongsToRead -= numBytesRead/sizeof(UInt_t);
00396       }
00397       if (numBytesRead <= 0 || numBytesRead % sizeof(UInt_t) != 0) {
00398         socketReader->fSocketIsOK = false;
00399       }
00400       continue;
00401     }
00402     /*************************************************************/
00403     /*************************************************************/
00404 
00405     /*************************************************************/
00406     /* We have room for it, so now figure out how to read it out.*/
00407     /*************************************************************/
00408 
00409     firstRead = (socketReader->fCircularBuffer.writeIndex >= 
00410                  socketReader->fCircularBuffer.readIndex) ?
00411       socketReader->fCircularBuffer.bufferLength 
00412         - socketReader->fCircularBuffer.writeIndex :
00413       socketReader->fCircularBuffer.readIndex 
00414         - socketReader->fCircularBuffer.writeIndex;
00415 
00416     
00417     pthread_rwlock_unlock(&socketReader->fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00418 
00419     /* First and second reads are set to make sure the wrapping works 
00420        correctly. */
00421     if (firstRead > numLongsToRead) firstRead = numLongsToRead;
00422     secondRead = (firstRead < numLongsToRead) ? numLongsToRead - firstRead : 0;
00423 
00424     pthread_rwlock_wrlock(&socketReader->fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00425 
00426     /* ROOT automatically calls the receive function so that we
00427        don't have to cycle through the calls. That is, it *will*
00428        get all the bytes requested or error. */
00429     numBytesRead = ReadoutRootSocket(sock, 
00430               socketReader->fCircularBuffer.buffer 
00431               + socketReader->fCircularBuffer.writeIndex, 
00432               firstRead*sizeof(UInt_t)); 
00433     if (numBytesRead <= 0 || numBytesRead != (Int_t)(firstRead*sizeof(UInt_t))) {
00434       // Problem in the socket, or closed connection. 
00435       pthread_rwlock_unlock(&socketReader->fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00436       socketReader->fSocketIsOK = false;
00437       break;
00438     } 
00439     socketReader->fCircularBuffer.writeIndex += numBytesRead/sizeof(UInt_t);
00440     socketReader->fCircularBuffer.amountInBuffer += numBytesRead/sizeof(UInt_t);
00441 
00442     if (socketReader->fCircularBuffer.writeIndex 
00443         == socketReader->fCircularBuffer.bufferLength) {
00444       socketReader->fCircularBuffer.writeIndex = 0;
00445     }
00446 
00447     if (secondRead != 0) {
00448       numBytesRead = ReadoutRootSocket(sock, 
00449                 socketReader->fCircularBuffer.buffer 
00450                 + socketReader->fCircularBuffer.writeIndex,
00451                 secondRead*sizeof(UInt_t)); 
00452       if (numBytesRead <= 0 || numBytesRead != (Int_t)(secondRead*sizeof(UInt_t))) {
00453         // Problem in the socket, or closed connection. 
00454         pthread_rwlock_unlock(&socketReader->fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00455         socketReader->fSocketIsOK = false;
00456         break;
00457       } 
00458       socketReader->fCircularBuffer.writeIndex += numBytesRead/sizeof(UInt_t);
00459       socketReader->fCircularBuffer.amountInBuffer += numBytesRead/sizeof(UInt_t);
00460       socketReader->fCircularBuffer.wrapArounds++;
00461     }
00462 
00463     /* OK, we're done reading into the circular buffer, unlock it. */
00464     pthread_rwlock_unlock(&socketReader->fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00465      
00466   }
00467 
00468   pthread_rwlock_wrlock(&socketReader->fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00469   socketReader->fCircularBuffer.isRunning = false;
00470   pthread_rwlock_unlock(&socketReader->fCircularBuffer.cbMutex);
00471 
00472   pthread_exit((void *) 0);
00473 }
